name: React Hooks
description: Understanding React Hooks for functional components

cards.back: A React hook that allows you to add state to functional components. Returns [state, setState]
A React hook that lets you perform side effects in functional components, similar to componentDidMount and componentDidUpdate

cards.front: What is the dependency array in useEffect?
cards.back: The second parameter of useEffect that controls when the effect runs. Empty array [] means run once on mount
A React hook that allows you to access context values without prop drilling
A React hook that returns a memoized callback function, useful for preventing unnecessary re-renders
A React hook that returns a memoized value, useful for expensive calculations
No, hooks must be called at the top level of a component, not inside loops, conditions, or nested functions
